articles.title: Oscar Nominee Whit Stillman Behind Rom-Com ‘The Splendid Affinities’
articles.description: Oscar nominee Whit Stillman is making rom-com 'The Splendid Affinities' with 'Argentina 1985' producer Infinity Hill and 'A Prophet' producer Lauranne
articles.content:
EXCLUSIVE: Oscar-nominated director Whit Stillman (Metropolitan) is turning his hand to big budget rom-com adventure TV with The Splendid Affinities, a series set across Paris, Madrid and London.

articles.title: Study: Don't blame climate change for South American drought
articles.description: Climate change isn’t causing the multi-year drought that is devastating parts of Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil and Bolivia, but warming is worsening some of the dry spell’s impacts, a new study says.
articles.content: FILE - Birds fly over a man taking photos of the exposed riverbed of the Old Parana River, a tributary of the Parana River, during a drought in Rosario, Argentina, on July 29, 2021. Climate change isn’t causing the multi-year drought that is devastat... [4161 chars]

articles.title: Study: Don't blame climate change for South American drought
articles.description: Scientists say climate change isn't to blame for the nasty three-year drought still devastating Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil and Bolivia.

articles.title: A new Lionel Messi mural, the “first mosaic mural” of him lifting the world cup trophy emerges in Buenos Aires, Argentina
articles.description: Messi is in the center holding the trophy aloft while wearing the bisht, the black and gold tunic Qatari's leader placed over his shoulders during the trophy ceremony at the end of the world cup.
articles.content: A new mural of Lionel Messi, reportedly the “first mosaic mural” of him lifting the world cup, has appeared on a street wall in downtown Buenos Aires in Argentina. A group of conglomerate artists from ‘National Mosaic’ movement are behind it. They ha... [1138 chars]

articles.title: Carlos Alcaraz Makes Winning Return to Reach Argentina Open Quarters
articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz won his first match of the year, beating Laslo Djere 6-2, 4-6, 6-2 in the Argentina Open
articles.content:
Carlos Alcaraz made a winning return to tennis after a four-month injury absence on Wednesday, defeating Serbia’s Laslo Djere to advance to the quarter-finals of the Argentina Open in Buenos Aires.
The 19-year-old Spaniard showed signs of ring-rustin... [1806 chars]

articles.title: Alcaraz wins 1st match of the year at Argentina Open
articles.description: The 19-year-old U.S. Open champion missed the Australian Open with a leg injury and ceded the No. 1 ranking to Novak Djokovic, who won the title in Melbourne.
articles.content:
Second-ranked Carlos Alcaraz won his first match of the year on Wednesday, beating Laslo Djere 6-2, 4-6, 6-2 in the Argentina Open.

articles.title: Argentina fines Edesur $5 million for power outages
articles.description: Argentina's Economy Ministry said on Wednesday it will fine power company Edesur 1 billion pesos ($5.2 million) for persistent power outages in Buenos Aires.
articles.content: Argentina's Economy Ministry said on Wednesday it will fine power company Edesur 1 billion pesos ($5.2 million) for persistent power outages in Buenos Aires. Outages this year have come amid high electricity demand due to a heatwave. Residents, some ... [566 chars]

articles.title: Bizarrap & Shakira Top Argentina Hot 100 Chart for a Fourth Week
articles.description: Plus, Big One, Emilia and Callejero Fino’s “En La Intimidad” debuts at No. 9.
articles.content: Bizarrap and Shakira add a fourth week atop the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 53” rules the Feb. 11-dated ranking. It’s the third “Music Session” by BIzarrap to crown the chart for at least four weeks, after “Vol. 38... [1386 chars]

articles.title: UPDATE 3-More South American nations report bird flu cases; Brazil remains free
